channel.title: Building a player base?
channel.description:
One of my biggest issues when hosting a private server is building a community/player base.
I'll get tons of clicks/hits, but a good portion don't join because they see my server is empty. Don't get me wrong, a couple players come and check it out, but if they don't see many active players, they too will eventually leave.
What do you guys do to get an active player base, or at least start one to eventually get more players.
I know the basics, like Advertise everywhere, show players the parts of your server that make them want to join, have a catchy advert, be unique, etc.
But obviously it goes a little further than a couple forum posts and some graphics.
So, what are your tips/tricks on getting a player base?

item.title: Building a player base?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Frankly I imagine it’s quite easy.
Step 1: Have a product, build some interest in it, but be reasonable - don’t raise everyone’s expectations. If you plan to only release a new feature every fortnight then make this sort of thing clear. Everybody knows what to expect that way.
Step 2: Release it into the wild. Continue to manage expectations and put the level of work into it that you said you would.

If your product is rock-solid (that is, it’s stable and always online) and fun to play then it will speak for itself, and naturally it follows that people will be attracted to it.

I think one of the larger problems with some of the stuff around here is hype and burnout. School students on summer vacation notwithstanding, nobody has the time to work on a server as if it were full time employment. This is why it’s crucial to manage the expectations that people have.
If you set reasonable expectations and then meet them then you can stay in it for the long haul, and that too will attract people to your product.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a player base?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

I’m not really one to be commenting (seeing as I have a reputation of having servers with a horrible amount of players), but I’ll post anyways.

Developmental Stage

I say to make a project thread before making your advertisements. I also suggest you make the project thread around 1 month before you plan on making the official release. On your project thread, make the release date clear. You’ll shift your hype to that set date. Make it your commitment to stick to that date. Why 1 month? Because it shows you are actually progressing. It shows progress and the hype is shifted to the set date that you said.

The day of release

When you release your server, do NOT rush to buy advertisements. Buying advertisements is a horrible idea because usually when one clicks an advertisement they expect the server has already been populated and they can join the community, not make the community. This stage is the hardest point. Hook yourself up with people who know many people. Word of mouth is great.

Voting sites should be your aim. You can feel free to buy premium or something on voting sites as those will boost your status on the rankings.

When you have a decent and stable playerbase

Decent playerbase is you having around 20 players.
Stable playerbase is you maintaining that for a good amount of the day.

At this stage, start buying advertisements.

You now have a community.
You now have some money to spend from purchases your current playerbase made.
You now have the tools to success.

Read full topic

@Hyperon wrote:

Just create a lon gterm development thread and then after a few months you should have 10 or 20 people waiting to play. So long as your shit does not suck… or you could pose as a female admin.

item.title: Building a player base?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:14, topic:548840”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=667746.msg4465961#msg4465961 date=1420163246]
You guys keep saying “You need to build it before”…
The question I’m asking is “How do you build it?”
[/quote]network. many people in the communities have ran servers before. theyre bound to be people who have lists of players’ emails/skypes/facebooks etc. but they may not have time to run a server anymore.

make friends. make connections. and spread the word. its not too hard unless everyone hates you. [/quote]

sinisoul:

i swear to go the next person to skype me a ‘upcoming’ server will get their throat slit

Yeah I’m not really a fan of those mass messages either…

item.title: Building a player base?
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

Like Lare said, building a community before you launch if a good way. Another good way is to good people on YouTube with a decent amount of subscribers to make videos promoting your server. Trust me, it’ll help a lot. I wouldn’t bother with buying ads on a RSPS website, at least the big ones which have them way over priced. Take advantage of top-list and when they reset. If you can get a good amount of votes in when they reset you’ll attract some people.

Read full topic
